Sentencas: To capture as much carbon dioxide as possible while minimizing the performance degradation, this study proposes two solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)/polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cell (PEMFC) hybrid systems.
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: One is a hybrid system in which the PEMFC not only generates power, but also performs the role of CC (hybrid system 1).
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: The other is a hybrid system in which pressure swing adaption (PSA) is incorporated to capture carbon dioxide, and consumption of hydrogen in the PEMFC is maximized (hybrid system 2).
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: In addition, an organic Rankine cycle (ORC) was added to further improve the performance of the hybrid systems by utilizing the waste heat of exhaust gas.
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: The cascade effects between SOFC and PEMFC contribute to achieving nearly complete CC and high efficiency.
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: Especially, hybrid system 2 achieved 10% and 5%p improvements over the stand-alone SOFC system in net power and efficiency.
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: It is promising in that the proposed systems utilizing cascade effects can achieve nearly zero carbon emission and high efficiency despite the use of natural gas without hydrogen supply.
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency

Sentencas: In other words, the proposed systems are expected to contribute to the realization of carbon neutrality without waiting for the technological maturation associated with hydrogen.(c) 2023 The Author(s).
Titulo: Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency
Thermodynamic design and analysis of SOFC/PEMFC hybrid systems with cascade effects: A perspective on complete carbon dioxide capture and high efficiency
